title: Make the site logo act as a Home button (always navigate to the main homepage)

requirements.text: Update the public site logo area in `frontend/src/components/PublicLayout.tsx` so that clicking the logo navigates the user directly to the main homepage route (`/`) from any current route.

quotes: make if anyone click on logo user directly go to home page

acceptanceCriteria: When the user clicks the header logo on any route (e.g., `/services`, `/contact`, `/hr/employees`), the app navigates to `/` using client-side navigation (no full page reload).
The logo click target is keyboard-accessible (focusable) and has appropriate accessible labeling (e.g., link/button semantics and/or aria-label).
Existing navigation behaviors remain unchanged (smooth-scroll section links, HR Dashboard button routing, mobile menu open/close behavior).

requirements.text: Make the footer logo/brand area in `frontend/src/components/PublicLayout.tsx` also navigate to the main homepage route (`/`) when clicked, matching the header logo behavior.

quotes: make if anyone click on logo user directly go to home page

acceptanceCriteria: When the user clicks the footer logo/brand area on any route, the app navigates to `/` using client-side navigation (no full page reload).
The footer logo/brand click target is keyboard-accessible (focusable) and has appropriate accessible labeling (e.g., link/button semantics and/or aria-label).

constraints: Do not modify any files listed as immutable in SYSTEM_CONTEXT (e.g., `frontend/src/hooks/useActor.ts`, `frontend/src/main.tsx`, `frontend/src/components/ui/*`).
Keep all user-facing text in English.
Do not change existing navigation item labels or their smooth-scroll behavior.
nonGoals: Do not change the existing section anchor IDs or smooth-scroll implementation.
Do not add new pages, routes, or backend methods for this change.
Do not change the logo image asset or generate new images.
